metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9374 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Double free vulnerability in the WebSocket Server (res_http_websocket module) in Asterisk Open Source 11.x before 11.14.2, 12.x before 12.7.2, and 13.x before 13.0.2 and Certified Asterisk 11.6 before 11.6-cert9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) by sending a zero length frame after a non-zero length frame.

criterions.comment: asterisk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
